titleStmt.title: The mock-tempest, or, The enchanted castle acted at the Theatre Royal / written by T. Duffett.
titleStmt.author: Duffett, Thomas.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A36759 of text R11449 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing D2448). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 146 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 33 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The mock-tempest, or, The enchanted castle acted at the Theatre Royal / written by T. Duffett.
titleStmt.author: Duffett, Thomas.
Shadwell, Thomas, 1642?-1692. Tempest.
Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616. Tempest.

notesStmt.note: A burlesque of Shadwell's opera, The tempest, which was based on D'Avenant's and Dryden's adaptation of Shakespeare.
The 2nd impression. Cf. Montague Summers reprint in Shakespeare adaptations, 1922, p. xiii-xiv.
Reproduction of original in British Library.

ep:epHeader.ep:title: The Mock Tempest, or The Enchanted Castle
ep:epHeader.ep:defectRangePerGrade: The rate of 13.82 defects per 10,000 words puts this text in the C category of texts with between 10 and 35 defects per 10,000 words.
